result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre Martese Mullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Deandre Martese Mullen was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deandre Martese Mullen is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Deandre Martese Mullen was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Deandre Martese Mullen was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, asessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during the course of Extended Supervision to the probation  agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of Extended supervision will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; and concurrent with count four. Credit for six (6) days.

superMiscConds.notes: No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
Follow the rules set forth by your agent.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
__________
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendat will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D264B
cf
Filed, Notice Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief
Count four.
Count six.

Defendant Deandre Martese Mullen in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Defendant Deandre Martese Mullen in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Blanch M. and Tashima S.

AS TO COUNT 4 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 1 MONTH in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 6 and consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 6 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 6 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent with Count 4, with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Follow the rules set forth by your agent. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of extended supervision to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of extended supervision will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

"We the jury, find the defendant, Deandre Mullen, guilty of possessing a controlled substance, tetrahydrocannabinols, as charged in Court Four of the information.  We the jury, find the defendant, Deandre Mullen, not guilty of delivering a controlled substance, cocaine, as a party to a crime, as charged in Court Five of the information.  We the jury, find the defendant, Deandre Mullen, guilty of delivering a controlled substance, cocaine, as a party to a crime, as charged in Court Six of the information."

Defendant Deandre Martese Mullen in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury trial continued.  Jury began deliberating at 9:00 am.  Case recalled at 11:51 am.  Sheriff's Deputies Quiles and Berlin sworn prior to case being called.  Jury in the box at 11:51 am.  Jury was released for lunch and told to return at 1:30 pm.

Deliberations resumed at 1:02 pm.  Jury in the box at 2:50 pm.  At the hour of 2:50 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY as to Count 5 and GUILTY as to Count 4 and Count 6, which was then read.  Court polled as to each count and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entries of judgment of conviction as to Counts 4 and 6 and an entry of judgment of acquittal as to Count 5.  State's motion for remand of the defendant granted.  Defendant taken into custody.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing on 10/29/15 at 1:30 pm in Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Exhibit list received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Written stipulation received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Deandre Martese Mullen in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury trial continued.  Case recalled at 1:48 pm.  Jury in the box at 1:48 pm.  Testimony of defense witness Deandre Mullen continued.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 1:56 pm.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Exhibits 14 - 18 received by the Court and filed.  Jury in the box at 2:02 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box at 2:40 pm.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:20 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Callies and Johnson who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Case recalled at 4:50 pm. Jury in the box.  Jury released for the evening and told to return at 9:00 am on 10/28/15.  Jury out of the box at 4:53 pm.

Defendant Deandre Martese Mullen in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury trial continued.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Department Detective Daniel DiTorrice and West Allis Police Department Detective Nick Stachula.  Exhibits 16 - 18 received.  Jury released for 15 minute break and told to return at 11:15 am.  Jury out of the box at 10:57 am.  Attorney Susan Roth appeared on behalf of witness, Mario W.  Mario W. in court, in custody, with attorney Roth.  Court held colloquy with witness regarding his decision to testify.  Upon questioning, Court finds the witness, Mario W. freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to testify.  Case passed.

Case recalled at 11:23 am.  Statement made during sentencing of witness, Mario W. placed on the record by defense.  Defense motion for jury to hear such statement denied by the Court.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for defense: Deandre Mullen.  Jury released for lunch and told to return at 1:30 pm.  Jury out of the box at 11:57 am.

Defendant Deandre Martese Mullen in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of the box at 2:17 pm.  Jury in the box at 2:21 pm.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Department Corporal Stephen Heckler.  Exhibits 2 - 9 received.  Jury out of the box at 3:09 pm.  Jury in the box at 3:29 pm.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Department Detective Thomas Carr.  Exhibits 10 - 12 received.  Jury out of the box at 4:00 pm.

Case recalled at 4:11 pm.  Discussion with Mario W.'s attorney, Susan Roth placed on the record.  Jury in the box at 4:16 pm.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Detective James Henner.  Exhibits 13 - 15 received.  Jury released for the evening and told to return at 9:00 am on 10/27/15.  Jury out of the box.  Exhibits 1 - 13 received by the Court and filed.
